snippet: In an effort to challenge the dominance of Apple and Google, Microsoft has increased incentives for developers to create brand-name apps for its Windows Phone app store.
abstract: Microsoft, In an effort to challenge the dominance of Apple and Google, increases incentives for developers to create brand-name apps for its Windows Phone app store; it is plying them with free smartphones, offering prime advertising spots and financing app development.

byline.original: By JENNA WORTHAM and NICK WINGFIELD

lead_paragraph: In an effort to challenge the dominance of Apple and Google, Microsoft has increased incentives for developers to create brand-name apps for its Windows Phone app store.

headline.seo: To Fill Out Its App Store, Microsoft Wields Its Checkbook
headline.main: Microsoft Is Writing Checks to Fill Out Its App Store
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Is Writing Checks to Fill Out App Store
